alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Franklin; Pickaway (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 6:40PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHWESTERN FAIRFIELD AND NORTHEASTERN PICKAWAY COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 640 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Pickerington, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Pickerington, Canal Winchester, Groveport, Baltimore, Lithopolis, Carroll and Slate Run Metro Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
